channel.title: Revision tips
channel.description:
It's that time of year again :( I have my AS exams coming up and im sure many of you have got some as well.
So post ways of revising that help you.
mine: Taking notes then highlighting key points. Use small prompt cards and right key info on them, and then stick them around the house. Do extra research to get a better understanding.

item.title: Revision tips
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

I really hate History, or maybe it’s the teacher perhaps that makes me feel that way.

In Year 11 and 12 we have the ability to drop out of these subjects, but not Year 10 where I am currently.

Read full topic

item.title: Revision tips
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Lucky for me, I only have Business Studies and History to revise for. Business is a bit of a joke, but History is fucking hard. I can do a bit for English, but not too much. I’ll revise for english closer to the exam.

Read full topic

item.title: Revision tips
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Notes don’t help me very much to be honest.

I’m more of a visual learner, e.g. Diagrams, pictures.

Read full topic

item.title: Revision tips
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I learn from books and classes only. But I only have tests now.

I used to make summary’s for 1 of my finals, but I had to learn 8 different courses, and all courses were 1 complete book or more. So I made a summary for history, as there were a lot of dates you had to remember together with the event that happened on that date.

Read full topic
